title.narrative: UNICEF Protection and care of girl and boy victims or at risk of child rights' violations in Mali, engagement

description.narrative: The objective of the project is to ensure that the most conflict affected children in the North and the Centre of Mali receive appropriate holistic support to alleviate their suffering and help them to recover their dignity and rightful place in their communities. It aims at ensuring the protection of boys and girls affected by the crisis, including children associated with armed groups, unaccompanied and separated children and girl survivors of gender-based and sexual violence by providing them with the appropriate care and protection services as well as socioeconomic reintegration support (school, vocational training, income generating activities).

title.narrative: 100 children released from forces and armed groups have access to holistic care services, community and socio-economic reintegration opportunities

description.narrative:
Indicator 1: Number of children suspected and/or released from forces and armed groups /CAAFAGs receiving interim care or family reunification (including children released from detention).
Indicator 2: Number of children released from forces and armed groups / CAAFAGs accessing to retinegration opportunities and/or socio-economic reintegration (data disaggregated by sex)

title.narrative: 100 children released from forces and armed groups have access to holistic care services, community and socio-economic reintegration opportunities

description.narrative:
Indicator 1: Number of children suspected and/or released from forces and armed groups /CAAFAGs receiving interim care or family reunification (including children released from detention).
Indicator 2: Number of children released from forces and armed groups / CAAFAGs accessing to retinegration opportunities and/or socio-economic reintegration (data disaggregated by sex)

comment.narrative:
Indicator 1: 213. With a total target of 400 of which Denmark contributes with 100.
Indicator 2: 194. With a total taget of 400 of which Denmark contribues with 100.

title.narrative: 100 unaccompanied and separated children receive transitional care services and reunited with their biological families and communities

description.narrative:
Indicator 1: Number of unaccompanied and separated children (UASC) identified and placed in alternative care arrangements (FAT - CTO) or who have benefited from individual follow-up (Data disaggregated by sex)
Indicator 2: Number of unaccompanied children reunited with their families (data disaggregated by sex)

title.narrative: 100 unaccompanied and separated children receive transitional care services and reunited with their biological families and communities

description.narrative:
Indicator 1: Number of unaccompanied and separated children (UASC) identified and placed in alternative care arrangements (FAT - CTO) or who have benefited from individual follow-up (Data disaggregated by sex)
Indicator 2: Number of unaccompanied children reunited with their families (data disaggregated by sex)

comment.narrative:
Indicator 1: 478 Total UNICEF target is 600, of which 100 is related to the Danish contribution
Indicator 2: 160 Total UNICEF target is 600 of which 100 is related to the Danish contribution.

title.narrative: Girls and boys affected by the crisis in the northern and central regions of Mali, including children released from armed groups, unaccompanied and separated and victims of sexual violence, benefit from transitional and holistic / multisectoral care, family reunification and socioeconomic reintegration.

description.narrative: Number of children being victim of violence, abuse and exploitation referred to appropriate care services and /or receiving appropriate care and community reintegration services

title.narrative: 80 girls survivor of gender-based violence (including sexual exploitation and abuse) in a conflict context have access to multi-sectorial care services.

description.narrative: Number of survivors of GBV who recieve appropriate care and support. Disaggregated by sex and age, women, girls, boys and men.
